interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Facial Skincare,Cucumber Essence Hydrating Moisturizing Revitalizing Hydration Fruit Extract Deep Cleaning Facial Skincare Sheet for All Skin Type Care, 35ml/1.18oz, Pack of 5 Review Date: 2020/10/21 Store: PalNour Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {} Review Text: I liked these masks and although I did have some issues with the 'essence' and absorption, I did not have any allergic reactions. I have been using masks to combat skin issues I have been having from wearing medical masks. So far this mask has been one of my favorites.

- Extremely hydrating and cooling.
-Made my skin very soft and smooth for a couple days afterwards.
-Easy to use.
-Large enough to cover my entire face.
-Enough balm to cover my face, neck and probably my entire body.
-Mask did become invisible when I had it on. Not that this is super important, but my husband does a mask that makes him look like a robber and it was just an interesting observation.

-Has an insane amount of the cucumber balm - so much extra that I needed to wipe it off before I could actually rub it in after I took the mask off.
-The balm took forever to dry after I took the mask off. It was not bad, but my face did feel sticky for hours afterwards and I woke up with a tacky face in the middle of the night. Seriously, it was a lot of cucumber. I had to change my pillow case in the morning. Review Title: A Very Balmy, But All Around Good Face Mask Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
BFWood BFWood {'Brand': 'BFWood', 'Shape': 'Oblong', 'Unit Count': '1.00 Count', 'Hair Type': 'All, Dry, Curly, Thick', 'Material': 'Nylon', 'Package Dimensions': '9.92 x 9.45 x 1.85 inches; 5.08 Ounces'} As most of us are in quarantine and not currently getting regular hair maintenance, having weird hair right now is just normal. I am growing out a pixie cut, not by choice, but by mandate of the State of Michigan. I have experienced a number of difficult hair transitions during this stay home, stay safe period, all of which I hope to never experience again. Currently, my hair is just too short to tuck behind my ear, so it is constantly falling in my face, but thankfully, I am past the super trendy mullet stage.

When I had my pixie cut for seven years I washed my hair and dried it with a towel and went on with my life. No comb, no brush, no anything. It was really nice. Now that I actually have hair that tangles and needs attention I require tools. I have a brush with tight bristles that I like, but it pulls. I use leave in conditioner gel that seems to help, but I still pull a lot of hair. I have a very inexpensive comb that does absolutely nothing and I should probably just recycle it.

This specific comb and brush set is definitely not the fanciest around. The comb has some heft to it and it does a good job getting my part straight. The brush is very stiff compared to my other brush, but it does not pull all my hair out when it hits a tangle. I also like that this brush doesn't mash my hair down. I have thinner hair and this brush doesn't make me look like I have thin hair.

I don't use any styling products or tools, so I am not hard on my brush. I think this brush will hold up just fine in my hands, but I think if I person were using it with lots of accessories and products it might be a placeholder for a more expensive brush. Decent Brush For Thin Short Hair Folora 4pcs Premium 1 Inch Wide Solid Color Floral Plaid Headband Set for Women Girls, Green Folora {'Material': 'Plastic', 'Brand': 'Folora', 'Unit Count': '4.00 Count', 'Product Dimensions': '4.72 x 0.98 x 5.51 inches; 3.53 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FLR-HB-4pcs Green'} When the covid pandemic hit I had a very short pixie cut, which gradually turned into a mullet because I was unable to get a haircut. I am a creature of habit and I have been getting my hair cut by the same person every fourth Saturday at 9 am for the past seven years. I do not like change. A lot of things happened at the same time. The person who cut my hair moved away, covid shut down our world and my hair continued to grow. I was a mess. I tried using stretchy elastic headbands and found those stayed in place for about fifteen seconds. I successfully used felt backed headbands, but as my hair has grown longer I've found the hair in the back does not cooperate as nicely and the back of the band slips up constantly.

I decided to try these bands only because I am now desperate. They work. Huzzah.

I will say that I wish they were a little wider and in black, but I know they are meant to appeal to women and girls who want to accessorize and not to people like me who have on more than one occasion stated "my favorite color is gray". These headbands stay in place. I have been wearing the plain green one for about six hours in the kitchen, around our two dogs and doing laundry and it has not moved. Also, it does not pinch behind my ears, which I completely anticipated being a problem I would need to deal with, but I was wrong. I have noticed the felt backing has already started to come unglued, which means I am going to need to get the glue gun out and fix it. These are not headbands that are made to last for years. The price does reflect that fact. I have been using masks to combat skin issues I have been having from wearing medical masks. So far this mask has been one of my favorites.

- Extremely hydrating and cooling.
-Made my skin very soft and smooth for a couple days afterwards.

-Large enough to cover my entire face.
-Enough balm to cover my face, neck and probably my entire body.
-Mask did become invisible when I had it on. Not that this is super important, but my husband does a mask that makes him look like a robber and it was just an interesting observation.

-Has an insane amount of the cucumber balm - so much extra that I needed to wipe it off before I could actually rub it in after I took the mask off.
-The balm took forever to dry after I took the mask off. It was not bad, but my face did feel sticky for hours afterwards and I woke up with a tacky face in the middle of the night. profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Hair Care Focus**: The user continues to navigate their transition from a pixie cut to longer hair, particularly during challenging times like the pandemic. They prioritize managing tangles effectively while minimizing damage.

- **Product Preferences**: Functionality and practicality remain crucial, as the user seeks hair accessories that simplify use without luxury frills. They have begun experimenting with headbands that hold their hair in place comfortably.

- **Hair Type Characteristics**: The user has thinner hair that tangles easily, necessitating gentle handling tools that also maintain volume during growth. They have successfully identified reliable headbands suited to their hair type and length.

- **Simplicity in Routine**: A low-maintenance hair routine is vital for the user, who seeks minimal products and tools to streamline styling as their hair grows.

- **Skincare Interest**: The user has expanded their self-care routine to include facial skincare, particularly sheet masks to address skin issues exacerbated by wearing medical masks. They appreciate hydrating and soothing products that are easy to use, although they have experienced some absorption issues.

- **Overall Experience**: Having previously been dissatisfied with hair tools, the user now prioritizes well-reviewed items that meet their needs and enhance their routine, focusing on effectiveness and comfort across both hair and skincare products.
